creditline: Gift of Ms. Sheryl R. Johnson, wife of artist Paul Lamantia
description: black-and-white drawing of two humanoid figures, one standing on left and once in center wearing masked linear garb, standing in a chaotic scene; cracked egg with dripping yolk in URQ; head wearing hat or helmet in LRQ; animal shape with thought bubble that has been broken in half in bottom right; manhole with series of spindly legs coming out of it; linear designs on upper edge
inscription: on back, in bottom right, in black ink: PAUL LAMANTIA | \"ROAD KILL\" | #26 | 1970 (PENCIL, INK) | H 30 3/16 X l 40 1/2
medium: Graphite and black ink on paper
provenance: The artist, Chicago; Sheryl R. Johnson, Chicago (wife of the artist); given to MIA, 2018.
title: Road Kill
